body:
update: 
when I tried to run the same from python shell using urllib3 i got the same error.
when i run the following (using certifi model) 
```

>>>import certifi
>>>import urllib3
>>>http = urllib3.PoolManager(cert_reqs='CERT_REQUIRED', ca_certs=certifi.where())
>>> r=http.request('GET','https://*************:8086/query?u=*********&p=********&q=select+MEAN%28%22load1%22%29+as+%22load1%22+from+%22system%22&db=telegrafqa')
>>> r.data
b'{"results":[{"statement_id":0,"series":[{"name":"system","columns":["time","load1"],"values":[["1970-01-01T00:00:00Z",0.20373338154670995]]}]}]}\n

```
I got the relevant data.

Thanks,
Noy.

Hi Noy,

An error probably occurs when establishing the TLS connection. Could you please take a network capture with tcpdump or wireshark and give us the result of the TLS handshake?
Also @noypit could you confirm whether you are running on CentOS 8? I believe you meant CentOS 7 but your confirmation would be welcome.

Hi Noy,

the first tcpdump output shows the code is trying to use Basic Auth and clearly that is not what you expect here.
Authorization:.Basic

Any reason to use quotes around the "true" value, what happens if you remove them?

To clarify Loud ML 1.3.2 limitations, we have to update the documentation:
 - server authentication will use the ca_certs option and verify_ssl to verify the server's certificate
 - client certificate and client key options are not yet supported with influxDB in this release. Are you running a reverse proxy in front of InfluxDB to perform client authentication?

Best,
SÃ©bastien

Possible step we missed in the documentation:
 - Step 3: Create user to match certificate CN (Common Name)
https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/v1.6/administration/https_setup/

Also, we must review the influxdb client code and how the options are handled.
